Title: Master Thesis Enhancements in Automotive Ethernet for Advanced Applications
RoleDescription:
Your Master thesis will focus on addressing the limitations of 10Base-T1S, an Ethernet-based multi-drop bus solution that struggles to meet the performance requirements of critical real-time automotive applications. While 10Base-T1S offers a cost-effective and flexible networking solution, it falls short in delivering the low-latency, high-reliability communication essential for safety-critical systems.The thesis will involve a comprehensive study of the 10Base-T1S standard to understand its capabilities and limitations. By analyzing the networking needs of advanced automotive applications and their specific Quality of Service (QoS) requirements, you will propose and develop enhancements to the 10Base-T1S protocol. These improvements will aim to optimize real-time communication, reduce latency and enhance overall network performance to meet the demanding requirements of modern automotive networks.Utilizing development and prototyping platforms, along with simulation tools, you will test and validate these proposed enhancements. The outcome of this research aims to contribute to the evolution of automotive Ethernet solutions, providing more efficient, flexible and low-latency networking options to improve the performance and reliability of critical automotive applications.Education: Master studies in the field of Computer Science, Communications Engineering, Electrical Engineering or comparableExperience and Knowledge: basic knowledge of networking concepts and protocols, proficiency in programming languages such as Python or C++ is a plusPersonality and Working Practice: you are able to analyze complex issues quickly, communicate effectively with your team members and you can independently take initiative to drive projects forwardLanguages: good in EnglishStart: according to prior agreement
